    About Me

    Welcome to my homepage!

    Originally from South Korea, I moved to the US in 8th grade and had the privilege of attending The Rectory School in Connecticut, followed by Phillips Academy Andover in Massachusetts. With a passion for engineering, I embarked on a dual degree journey, obtaining a B.A. in Mathematics from Franklin & Marshall College, fully supported by the Clarkson Family Grant's generous scholarship. Currently, I am completing a B.S. in Computer Engineering at Columbia University in the City of New York.

    Now embracing NYC as my home, I am enthusiastically pursuing a variety of remote and local opportunities!

    Background

    Columbia University in the City of New York

    Coursework

    Software

    • Data Structures in Java: Studied the implementation and use of common data structures using Java.
    • Advanced Programming
    • Computer Science Theory
    • From Algorithm to Development
      • Final Group Project | Sudoku Solver; Solved Project Euler #96 Sudoku problem in Java with various optimizations such as using BufferedReader over Scanner, byte arrays instead of character arrays, bit shifting, and more with JProfiler monitoring; In addition, we hardcoded the Sudoku puzzle visually in terminal using Unicode character sequences in Java
    • Artificial Intelligence
    • Programming Languages and Translators (In Progress): Investigated language design and implementation, as well as compiler and interpreter construction.
    • Competitive Programming (In Progress): Practiced problem-solving and coding skills for competitive programming contests.
    • Applied Machine Learning (In Progress): Applied machine learning techniques to real-world problems and datasets.
    • Machine Learning for Finance (In Progress): Explored the use of machine learning algorithms for financial modeling and prediction.

    Hardware

    • Computer Networks
      • Set up my own virtual machine instance using Google Cloud and implemented adaptive bitrate selection in an HTTP proxy using the ABR algorithm
      • Streamed the highest quality encoding that the connection can handle with videos served from Apache server
      • Configured OSPF, iBGP, eBGP routing protocols and implemented various BGP policies utilizing FRRouting Software Suite
    • Intro to EE/Circuit Analysis:
      • Built a phaser, a signal processor intended for an electric guitar with an all-pass filter with variable MOSFET resistors
      • Built a speaker driver using LM741 op-amp and discrete transistors from the basis of a buffered unity gain circuit
      • Built rock paper scissors game on a circuit board using CMOS Quad XOR gates, pull-down resistors, and 5V Arduino
    • Signals & Systems
    • Advanced Logic Design
    • System-on-chip Platforms
    • Fundamentals of Computer Systems

    Franklin & Marshall College

    • Abstract Algebra

    Phillips Academy Andover

    Extracurricular Activities:

    • Andover Korean Society (AKS) - President: Organized and led events to promote Korean culture in the Andover community, including Korean Awareness Week and the Korean Talent & Fashion Show, which featured presentations, food sampling, and traditional performances.
    • Astronomy Club - Member (Variable Star Search): Participated in a team that utilized the MPO Canopus photometric analysis program to discover variable stars and submit findings to the Variable Star Index (VSX).
    • Yorkies - Tenor 2 and Beatboxer (Andover's Male Acapella Group): Performed in various on- and off-campus events such as Yorkling, where we caroled at student dorms, and Grasshopper Night, an annual student-led showcase for parents, faculty, and peers.
    • UNICEF Club - Board Member: Implemented new donation systems for Andover students, organized campaigns like UNICEF Trick-OR-Treat fundraiser, Chipotle burrito sale, and a foursquare tournament, and coordinated a social bazaar to collect and send useful items to UNICEF.

    The Rectory School

    Extracurricular Activities:

    • Valedictorian: Graduated in 2012 with the highest academic average, awarded the Goodridge-Barber Academic Cup.
    • Tri-Varsity Athlete (Soccer, Basketball, Golf): Served as team captain in Soccer and Golf, won consecutive MVP awards, and led the soccer team to an undefeated season in 2012.
    • Orchestra - First Violinist: Performed as the first violinist in the school orchestra, advanced to the Connecticut regional competition.
    • School Newspaper - Writer and Editor: Contributed articles and editorial support for the school newspaper.
